rocks.bastion.core

Interface Callback<M>

  • Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Callback<M>
    Performs an action after an API request has occurred and passed its assertions. Users can use Callbacks to extract information from response recieved by an API. This information can be used for later Bastion requests.

    By default, a BastionBuilderImpl builders start with the empty callback.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Callback<?> NO_OPERATION_CALLBACK
      The empty callback which does nothing.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute(int statusCode, ModelResponse<? extends M> response, M model)
      The actual Callback action to perform after a Bastion Request completes and it passes its assertions.
      static <M> Callback<M> noCallback()
      Returns the empty callback which does nothing.

    • Field Detail

      • NO_OPERATION_CALLBACK

        static final Callback<?> NO_OPERATION_CALLBACK
        The empty callback which does nothing.

    • Method Detail

      • noCallback

        static <M> Callback<M> noCallback()
        Returns the empty callback which does nothing.
        Type Parameters:
        M - The type of model which Bastion will bind the received response to
        Returns:
        The empty callback

      • execute

        void execute(int statusCode,
             ModelResponse<? extends M> response,
             M model)
        The actual Callback action to perform after a Bastion Request completes and it passes its assertions.
        Parameters:
        statusCode - The HTTP status code received by the API endpoint.
        response - The HTTP response information received from the API (including HTTP headers, etc.)
        model - The bound model which was extracted from the received HTTP response
